name: Kent's Enchilada Chicken Paillard with Red Enchilada Sauce
ingredients: 4 teaspoons granular Splenda or equivalent liquid
4 large or 8 small boneless chicken breasts (about 3 pounds total)
2 red bell peppers, coarsely chopped (about 6 ounces after trimming) *
1 large onion, julienned (about 8 ounces after trimming)

instructions.en: For the sauce: Cook chopped onion in oil until soft and slightly browned in a medium pot.
Add garlic and spices to the pot. Cook until fragrant.
Add tomato sauce, Splenda, and water. Simmer covered for at least 8 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pound chicken breasts until very thin. If using large breasts, cut them in half.
Brown seasoned chicken in batches in a large skillet with oil. Transfer to a greased 9x13 inch baking pan.
In the same skillet, cook peppers and onions until just tender, adding garlic near the end. Season and set aside.
In the skillet, whisk enchilada sauce with cream cheese over low heat. Add half the cheddar cheese and stir until melted.
Pour sauce over chicken, top with pepper mixture, and sprinkle remaining cheddar cheese.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

notes: * For bell peppers, you can use a mix of red and yellow if needed. This recipe makes 6-8 servings.
